results.title: Type 2014K Image Orthicon camera
results.creator_credit: Films & Equipment Ltd., Vinten and PYE Ltd.
results.brief_description: Pye cameras were used across Australia in newsrooms and in the field by journalists at GTV9 and ABV2. They are lightweight and compact, making them easy to transport, and they feature an extended focus range switch for extreme close-ups.

constellations_primary.name: News on location
constellations_primary.description: The Pye Orthicon is an example of the type of television cameras used from the 1950s in Australia for both studio and outside broadcast work. Such cameras did not have have the capacity to record while out on location and so outside crews would transmit vision and sound back to studios for recording or live broadcast.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Films & Equipment Ltd., Vinten and PYE Ltd.
results.description:
In 1948, Australian audiences were introduced to television at the Sydney Royal Easter Show. The British electronics company Pye had brought its 405-line cameras and monitors to encourage interest in the new medium.

While it would be eight years until Bruce Gyngell famously welcomed Australia to television, the Pye company was still essential to the burgeoning industry.

Pye cameras like this were used across Australia in newsrooms and in the field by journalists at GTV9 and ABV2. They are lightweight and compact, making them easy to transport, and they feature an extended focus range switch for extreme close-ups.
description_for_label:

results.title: Riding with voices
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: Boothlite
results.brief_description:
Video recording filmed by artists at Swinburne University as they complete the construction of ‘Boothlite’, an interactive multimedia installation. ‘Boothlite’ exhibited in 1996 in a collection of installations, footage of which appears in the video without title. A steel, rubber and perspex booth for one, ‘Boothlite’ features both an internal and external monitor. The internal monitor and keyboard allow the spectator to interact with a series of digital images and sequences; the external monitor invites those outside ‘Boothlite’ to go inside. In the video, the various artists involved discuss the work and battle against a sleepless block of 48 or more hours in order to get it finished in time for installation.

James Verdon is one of the artists who originally created a work know as ‘the Booth’. The Booth is a mini cinema which Cinemedia has commissioned James and others to build.

results.title: Neon Genesis Evangelion: The End of Evangelion
results.creator_credit: Kazuya Tsurumaki, Hideaki Anno, Mitsuhisa Ishikawa, SEGA, Toei Company, Kadokawa Shoten Publishing, Production I.G, TV Tokyo, Star Child Recording, Movic and GAINAX
results.brief_description: The second of two theatrically released follow-ups to the Neon Genesis Evangelion series about the battle between humanity and terrifying angels.

constellations_other.name: Evangelical animation
constellations_other.description: This Constellation exploring animation was created by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Melanie Kavanagh.

results.title_for_label: Neon Genesis Evangelion: The End of Evangelion
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kazuya Tsurumaki, Hideaki Anno, Mitsuhisa Ishikawa, SEGA, Toei Company, Kadokawa Shoten Publishing, Production I.G, TV Tokyo, Star Child Recording, Movic and GAINAX
results.description: The second of two theatrically released follow-ups to the Neon Genesis Evangelion series. Comprising of two alternate episodes which were first intended to take the place of episodes 25 and 26, this finale answers many of the questions surrounding the series, while also opening up some new possibilities.
description_for_label: The second of two theatrically released follow-ups to the Neon Genesis Evangelion series. Comprising of two alternate episodes which were first intended to take the place of episodes 25 and 26, this finale answers many of the questions surrounding the series, while also opening up some new possibilities.

results.title: The War Game
results.brief_description: Two boys quarrel about a toy pistol. The game becomes serious. On the roof in a skyskraper district they risk their lifes for the toy pistol.
results.description: In a stark apartment building, two children begin to playfully fight over a gun. As the tussle begins to escalate from play to something more serious, their fight takes them higher up the building where the intensity of their conflict is mirrored by the increasing danger of their surrounds.
description_for_label: In a stark apartment building, two children begin to playfully fight over a gun. As the tussle begins to escalate from play to something more serious, their fight takes them higher up the building where the intensity of their conflict is mirrored by the increasing danger of their surrounds.
results.media_note: Sorry, we aren't able to make images or video for this item available to the public online.

results.title: Adventure Time
results.creator_credit: Pendleton Ward, Cartoon Network Studios and Frederator Studios
results.brief_description: Hook up with Finn and Jake as they travel the Land of Ooo searching for adventure. But remember, adventure isn’t always easy.

constellations_other.name: Evangelical animation
constellations_other.description: This Constellation exploring animation was created by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Melanie Kavanagh.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Pendleton Ward, Cartoon Network Studios and Frederator Studios
results.description: Hook up with Finn and Jake as they travel the Land of Ooo searching for adventure. But remember, adventure isn’t always easy. Sometimes you’ve got to battle fire gnomes that torture old ladies, save a smelly hot dog princess from the Ice King, and thaw out a bunch of frozen businessmen. What the cabbage?!
description_for_label: Hook up with Finn and Jake as they travel the Land of Ooo searching for adventure. But remember, adventure isn’t always easy. Sometimes you’ve got to battle fire gnomes that torture old ladies, save a smelly hot dog princess from the Ice King, and thaw out a bunch of frozen businessmen. What the cabbage?!

results.title: Neon Genesis Evangelion
results.creator_credit: Yutaka Sugiyama, Noriko Kobayashi, Hideaki Anno and GAINAX
results.brief_description: At the turn of the century, the Angels returned to Earth, seeking to wipe out humanity in an apocalyptic fury. Mankind’s remnants retreated and bid their time, waiting to battle the Angels with bio-mechs known as Evangelions.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Yutaka Sugiyama, Noriko Kobayashi, Hideaki Anno and GAINAX
results.description: At the turn of the century, the Angels returned to Earth, seeking to wipe out humanity in an apocalyptic fury. Devastated, mankind’s last remnants moved underground to wait for the day when the Angels would come back to finish the job. Fifteen years later, that day has come… but this time, humanity is ready to fight back with terrifying bio-mechanical weapons known as the Evangelions. Watch as Shinji, Rei, Asuka and the rest of the mysterious shadow agency Nerv battle to save earth from total annihilation.
description_for_label: At the turn of the century, the Angels returned to Earth, seeking to wipe out humanity in an apocalyptic fury. Devastated, mankind’s last remnants moved underground to wait for the day when the Angels would come back to finish the job. Fifteen years later, that day has come… but this time, humanity is ready to fight back with terrifying bio-mechanical weapons known as the Evangelions. Watch as Shinji, Rei, Asuka and the rest of the mysterious shadow agency Nerv battle to save earth from total annihilation.

results.title: VHS
results.brief_description: The evolution of film to portable, tape-based cameras and the production and distribution of magnetic media like video continued the democratisation of the moving image. One sector that readily adopted magnetic media was education, with training and educational videos disseminated on the format. We now have a range of educational videos in our collection and the VHS camera featured here was used to shoot classes on filmmaking when ACMI was part of Cinemedia in the late 1990s. Rapid deterioration of video and the obsolescence of the equipment needed for playback pose critical preservation issues – we’re doing everything we can to save them.

results.title: Ready Player One
results.creator_credit: Adam Stockhausen, Dan Farah, Kristie Macosko, Ernest Cline, Kasia Walicka-Maimone, Donald De Line, Zak Penn, Steven Spielberg, Village Roadshow Pictures, Reliance Entertainment, Farah Films & Management, Dune Entertainment, Warner Bros. Pictures, De Line Pictures and Amblin Entertainment
results.brief_description: When the creator of a popular video game system dies, a virtual contest is created to compete for his fortune.

constellations_other.name: The Wilhelm scream, easters eggs and open world games
constellations_other.description: This Constellation tracks how an on-set in-joke became one of the first cinematic easter eggs. It was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies students Harrison Buikstra and Jasper Caverly.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Adam Stockhausen, Dan Farah, Kristie Macosko, Ernest Cline, Kasia Walicka-Maimone, Donald De Line, Zak Penn, Steven Spielberg, Village Roadshow Pictures, Reliance Entertainment, Farah Films & Management, Dune Entertainment, Warner Bros. Pictures, De Line Pictures and Amblin Entertainment
results.description: When the creator of a popular video game system dies, a virtual contest is created to compete for his fortune.
description_for_label: When the creator of a popular video game system dies, a virtual contest is created to compete for his fortune.

results.title: Devilman Crybaby
results.creator_credit: Go Nagai, Eunyoung Choi, Yōhei Shintaku, Dynamic Planning and Science SARU
results.brief_description: Akira Fudo learns from his best friend Ryo Asuka that demons will revive and reclaim the world from humans. With humans hopeless against this threat, Ryo suggests combining with a demon. With this, Akira becomes Devilman, a being with the power of demon but with a human heart.
